meta_description: A non-profit organization creating and celebrating the history, culture, and community of Johnstown, Pennsylvania.
admission_text:
# How we developed into one of PA's most dynamic heritage organizations.

Heritage Johnstown is a non-profit, membership-based organization that celebrates, fosters, and creates:

  * **History** – We collect, preserve, and interpret our community memory of Johnstown;
  * **Culture** – We attract, educate, and inspire visitors of all ages and backgrounds;
  * **Community** –We transform and develop our community by nurturing and celebrating a sense of place and shared identity.

We have always depended on the generosity of our community to make all this happen. We are grateful for your support!

[Donate to Heritage Johnstown today](https://www.heritagejohnstown.org/about-us/support/)

Here is a timeline with major events in our organization’s history.

### 1971

Heritage Johnstown is founded as the Johnstown Flood Museum Association, with the foremost mission of preserving and interpreting the story of the 1889 flood.

### 1973

The organization opens the **Johnstown Flood Museum** in the former Cambria (Carnegie) Library building.

### 1989

[](http://www.jaha.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2016/10/opening.jpg)The organization achieves its long-range goal of presenting a high quality visitor experience on the theme of the Johnstown Flood when it reopens the Johnstown Flood Museum following a $4 million capital investment that includes restoration and renovation of its building, and installation of a new permanent exhibition and a new film.
